content.question: In a lab, a student is given a <math alttext="21 gram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>21</mn><mtext> </mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of pure <math alttext="C u" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow></math> metal. Which of the following pieces of information is most useful for determining the number of <math alttext="C u" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow></math> atoms in the sample? Assume that the pressure and temperature in the lab are <math alttext="1.0 atmosphere" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext> </mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

choices.label: The molar mass of <math alttext="C u" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow></math>

The density of <math alttext="C u" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow></math> at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
The volume of the <math alttext="C u" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow></math> sample
The ratio of the two main isotopes found in pure <math alttext="C u" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow></math>

content.answer: The molar mass of <math alttext="C u" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
